result.execSummary:
The defendant Marques Jarvis Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and victim witness surcharges. To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 7/14/18.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other  sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marques Jarvis Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marques Jarvis Brown not in court.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from Department of Corrections on this date and forwarded to Court for review

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Department of Correction ATtn. Records 2909  E Park Ave. Chippewa Falls WI 54729.

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 22, Judge Witkowiak.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing JULY 14, 2015 received and filed. (47 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to PRISON SENTENCE.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/14/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/14/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Marques Jarvis Brown in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Marques Jarvis Brown in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices in court, defendant Marques Jarvis Brown not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is currently conducting a Motion Hearing. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/14/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Marques Jarvis Brown in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Marques Jarvis Brown in custody.  Ronald Dague for David J. Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
